abstract: The company said iPhone sales fell in the quarter because of widespread rumors that a new phone would be released, delaying consumer purchases.
snippet: The company said iPhone sales fell in the quarter because of widespread rumors that a new phone would be released, delaying consumer purchases.
lead_paragraph: For any other big company, a 54 percent increase in profit and a 39 percent jump in revenue would be enviable. For Apple though, weak sales of its star product — the iPhone — were enough to overshadow everything else when it reported fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, sending the company’s shares tumbling nearly 7 percent in after-hours trading.

headline.main: Apple’s Profit Gains 54%, but iPhone Sales Fall Short of Expectations
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Profit Gains 54%, but iPhone Sales Fall Short of Expectations
